placeDesc: This is considered the oldest garden in Prague and one of the oldest orchards in Europe. Once part of an orchard established in 1248, it was later enclosed by a monastery. It was opened to the public in 1954.It houses numerous apple, pear, plum, and other fruit trees as well as bee hives and flower gardens. It also houses a flock of peacocks. There are also two surviving chapels in the park, one of which takes the form of a cave.
placeShortDesc: The oldest garden in Prague, once part of an medieval orchard.
placeRelatedPlaces: Jardin du Tripot,Delta Sensory Gardens,Asticou Azalea Garden,Okochi Sanso Gardens
